revised_title: Chemical Composition and Properties of Alenrone Grains
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
tldr: The author investigates the chemical composition of alenrone grains in plant seeds, specifically focusing on the proteids stored up in the seeds of certain plants, like Leguminosae. They discovered that these proteids exist in two forms: hemialbumose, which is soluble in water, and globulins, which are insoluble in water but soluble in 10% NaCl solution. The study provides insights into the nature of these proteids and their role in plant cells.
